required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hand Therapy Approach on Lumbrical Muscle Tears in Sport Climbers
clinical_study.official_title: Hand Therapy Approach on Lumbrical Muscle Tears in Sport Climbers

brief_summary.textblock: This study aimes to analyze the effectiveness of a Hand Therapy protocol in the management of patients who suffer from a tear of a lumbrical muscle, regarding on the symptoms during the clinical examination, the disability in their activities of daily living and the sports-specific function.

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective intervention study is performed on 50 adult climbers suffering from an injury of the 4th lumbrical muscle. They wear during 3 weeks a 5th finger extension relative motion orthosis, while pain-free sport activities are permitted using a 4th and 5th fingers buddy-taping. After three weeks, patients are told to progressively remove the splint and, after six weeks, the splint is totally removed. Symptoms in the lumbrical stress test are evaluated during the 6 weeks period using dynamometry and goniometry, Finally, Quick-Disabilities of the arm shoulder and hand questionnaire is also analyzed.

primary_outcome.time_frame: It will be evaluated at 6 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Symptoms in the lumbrical stress test will be evaluated during the 6 weeks period using an adapted Jamar handgrip dynamometer on a climbing hold. The climber is told to pull on the hold until the pain starts.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: It will be evaluated at 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Finger flexion metacarpophalangeal joint goniometry of the 5th finger is measured during the lumbrical stress test when pain appears

secondary_outcome.measure: Quick-Disabilities of the arm shoulder and hand questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: It will be evaluated at 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked to answer "Quick-Disabilities of the arm shoulder and hand" questionnaire before the clinical examination. In "Quick-Disabilities of the arm shoulder and hand" each item has response options and, from the item scores, scale scores are calculated, raning from o (no disability) to 100 (most severe disability).

arm_group.description: 6-weeks relative motion splinting protocol, while pain-free sport activities are permitted

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult climbers suffering from an injury of the 4th lumbrical muscle
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with previous treatments.
- Patients with concomitant injuries or illness

reference.citation: Lutter C, Schweizer A, Schoffl V, Romer F, Bayer T. Lumbrical muscle tear: clinical presentation, imaging findings and outcome. J Hand Surg Eur Vol. 2018 Sep;43(7):767-775. doi: 10.1177/1753193418765716. Epub 2018 Mar 28.
Schweizer A. Lumbrical tears in rock climbers. J Hand Surg Br. 2003 Apr;28(2):187-9. doi: 10.1016/s0266-7681(02)00250-4.
